items.title: Indian supply chain startup Zetwerk bags $5m
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based B2B manufacturing startup Zetwerk has raised US$5 million in a funding round co-led by Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech Limited.
- The company issued 9,93,721 series F3 compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) priced at US$4.98 each.
- Arc Investments and Oriental Biotech each contributed US$1.15 million, with Stargazer Fund-I investing US$575,205, and additional funds from angel investors.
- This funding round is reportedly ongoing with potential for further capital to be raised soon.

items.title: Samsung considers US battery plant despite policy changes
items.summary:
- Samsung SDI Co. is exploring the possibility of building a new battery production facility in the US.
- CEO Joo Sun Choi highlighted the need for caution due to a decline in demand for electric vehicles (EVs) this year compared to last.
- The potential US plant is seen as part of Samsung SDI's long-term growth strategy despite current challenges and changes in US policies.

items.title: Malaysian proptech firm LiveIn acquires RedDoorz’s rental brand
items.summary:
- Malaysia-based proptech firm LiveIn acquires KoolKost, a long-term accommodation brand in Indonesia owned by RedDoorz.
- The acquisition encompasses 27 properties across six cities.
- KoolKost, founded in 2020, caters to long-term travelers, students, and workers with affordable accommodations offering amenities such as Wi-Fi, cleaning services, and drinking water.
- Post-acquisition, KoolKost will function as a sub-brand of LiveIn Indonesia, integrating its properties into LiveIn’s categories: LiveIn Intro, Select, and Signature.
- This acquisition responds to Indonesia's projected urbanization, with 66.6% of the population expected to reside in cities by 2035, driving demand for flexible and affordable housing.

items.title: TSMC won’t make advanced chips in US next year, minister says
items.author: Kuo Jyh-huei
items.summary:
- TSMC's most advanced chip technologies (2nm and 1.6nm) will not be produced in the US until at least 2026.
- Taiwan’s Economics Minister, Kuo Jyh-huei, confirmed this during a legislative session on March 4.
- Kuo stated that it is impossible for these processes to be introduced at TSMC’s US facilities next year.

items.title: SoftBank-backed cybersecurity CEO quits in funding battle
items.summary:
- Eric Gan has resigned as CEO of Cybereason due to boardroom conflicts and financial struggles.
- The cybersecurity startup is dealing with worsening funding issues and internal disputes.
- Gan cited irreconcilable differences with the board, following a lawsuit against investors Liberty Strategic Capital and SoftBank's Vision Fund, who are accused of blocking funding.
- Cybereason's valuation has dropped dramatically from US$5 billion in 2021 to between US$300 million and US$400 million as of 2023.
- Financial troubles, workforce cuts, and IPO delays threaten the company's viability, with a risk of bankruptcy.
- SoftBank provided a US$100 million lifeline in April 2023, but internal disputes continue to impede funding.
- The company plans to merge with Trustwave, but instability poses uncertainty for the deal.
- Gan intends to pursue legal action against the major investors, leaving the company’s future uncertain.

items.title: Sweden’s Areim raises $481m for sustainable data centers
items.summary:
- Swedish fund manager Areim raised €450 million (US$481 million) for sustainable data center development.
- The funding announcement took place on March 5.
- The initiative aims to reduce the environmental impact of data centers via its subsidiary, EcoDataCenter.
- Areim has not disclosed the identities of the international investors involved.
- EcoDataCenter focuses on minimizing emissions and optimizing energy efficiency using renewable energy and advanced technologies.
- The first data center operated by EcoDataCenter was launched in Falun, southern Sweden, in 2019.

items.title: Indian HR tech firm Darwinbox secures $140m in funding
items.summary:
- Hyderabad-based HR tech startup Darwinbox has raised US$140 million in a funding round co-led by Partners Group and KKR.
- The funding will support Darwinbox’s international expansion and technological enhancements.
- 60% of Darwinbox’s business currently originates from global markets, with international revenue increasing fivefold recently.
- Founded in 2015, Darwinbox provides a cloud-based HR management platform featuring recruitment, payroll, performance management, and employee engagement.
- Notable clients include Starbucks, Nivea, AXA, and WeWork.

items.title: Samsung union approves 5.1% wage increase
items.summary:
- The National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) approved a 5.1% wage increase for its members in 2025.
- The agreement was reached last month and required ratification by union members.
- The NSEU represents about 36,000 employees, approximately 30% of Samsung’s workforce in South Korea.
- Samsung will also provide employees with points for company product purchases and distribute 30 shares of company stock.

items.title: Discover your inner princess this International Women’s Day [Quiz]
items.summary:
- The article is part of Tech in Asia’s 2025 International Women’s Day campaign to support women in tech.
- It encourages a reimagining of the traditional fairy tale princess narrative by promoting strength and resilience.
- A quiz titled *Hello Princess* allows participants to explore their inner selves and personality by deciding how to escape a tower situation.
- The quiz aims to provide a deeper self-understanding and is open to all genders.
- This year’s International Women’s Day theme is “Accelerate Action,” focusing on both outward and inward actions to improve the world.

items.title: Korean wave is sweeping into Japan’s startup ecosystem
items.summary:
[The Korean wave is influencing Japan's startup ecosystem by introducing cultural trends and investment opportunities.]
[Japanese startups are increasingly collaborating with South Korean companies for innovation and market expansion.]
[The presence of K-pop and Korean entertainment is fostering interest among Japanese consumers, creating new business avenues.]

items.title: Foxconn’s first two month revenue jumps 25%
items.summary:
- Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. (Foxconn) reported a 25% revenue increase for January and February 2025, reaching NT$1.1 trillion (US$33.5 billion).
- This improvement is from an 11% growth in the same period last year. Analysts expect first-quarter revenue to reach NT$1.6 trillion (US$48.78 billion), a 22% year-on-year rise.
- Growth is attributed to strong demand for AI computing infrastructure, particularly Nvidia’s Blackwell-powered servers. Nvidia reported US$11 billion in revenue from this chip.
- Foxconn anticipates significant first-quarter growth as a key supplier for Nvidia AI servers and Apple products.
- Foxconn is expanding in the US, planning to manufacture AI servers in Houston in partnership with Apple later this year.

items.title: Nvidia stock drops on Nasdaq slump, China risks
items.summary:
- Nvidia's stock has contributed over 30% to the Nasdaq's decline this year.
- The stock fell below its 200-day moving average in January for the first time in over two years.
- Analysts have identified support levels at US$113, US$110, and potentially as low as US$90, with projections targeting US$107 to US$103.
- The stock's forward earnings multiple is now 25, the lowest in over a year.
- Market uncertainty affects major tech stocks; Nasdaq 100 is nearing correction territory.
- Tariffs and AI-related export restrictions, especially related to China, add to the pressure on Nvidia.
- Decreasing momentum and investor caution raise concerns, with some experts suggesting a long-term peak may have been reached.

items.title: AI dominates Wall Street as firms push monetization, IPOs
items.summary:
- Mentions of AI in Wall Street earnings calls reached a record high, with 50% of S&P 500 companies discussing AI, compared to 30% earlier in 2024.
- Only 6% of US companies actively use AI, with another 10% planning to adopt it.
- Strongest AI adoption is seen in tech, finance, and professional services, while sectors like transportation and construction are lagging.
- On Mar. 5, CoreWeave filed for an IPO after a 730% revenue increase to $1.9 billion in 2024, despite a loss of $863 million.
- CoreWeave's IPO may catalyze the 2025 IPO market.
- Companies are emphasizing AI monetization; Monday.com’s pay-per-minute AI model boosted its stock by 30%, while Fiverr and Kaltura’s launches saw stock declines.
- Investors are shifting focus to measurable financial impacts of AI in 2025.

items.title: UK regulator approves chip design software firm’s $35b deal
items.summary:
- The UK Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has approved Synopsys’ US$35 billion acquisition of Ansys.
- Initial concerns about the deal potentially hindering innovation and raising prices were addressed, leading to no in-depth investigation.
- Synopsys, a chip design tool provider, announced the acquisition deal in January; Ansys develops software used in various industries.

items.title: SEA’s AI players target end users as DeepSeek stifles LLMs
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, has raised competition in the AI sector, affecting even established players like OpenAI.
- In January, DeepSeek released a reasoning model for free, prompting OpenAI to integrate similar features into its free ChatGPT version.
- Southeast Asian startups may need to build on existing LLMs rather than competing with foundational models, focusing on practical use cases for agentic AI.
- Users prioritize application functionality over the underlying models, as seen with GoTo's migration from Google Cloud to Alibaba Cloud.
- Advanced LLMs have made language comprehension issues less significant, suggesting that the justification for developing regional LLMs may need further evaluation.

items.title: A cheat sheet of M&As in Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- Since 2006, Tech in Asia has tracked M&A activity in Southeast Asia.
- The article compiles trends and milestones in the region's M&A landscape.
- Highlights the average and median deal sizes and variations in deal structures.
- Discusses the most active M&A sectors and identifies top acquirers in the region.

items.title: Leap Finance secures $100m in debt facility from HSBC
items.summary:
- Leap Finance secured a US$100 million debt facility from HSBC under its ASEAN Growth Fund.
- The funding aims to assist more Indian students in pursuing postgraduate education abroad.
- Leap Finance has provided over US$250 million in education loans to more than 5,000 students.
- The company focuses on a student’s future earning potential for its collateral-free, USD-denominated loans.
- Plans to expand services across the United States and improve its presence in India.
- This follows a successful US$65 million series E equity round led by Apis Partners, increasing cumulative funding to over US$400 million since 2019.

items.title: Social platform Digg to relaunch
items.summary:
- Digg, a social platform, is set to relaunch, reviving its previous popularity.
- The relaunch aims to enhance user experience and engagement on social news sharing.
- More details on new features and updates will be revealed closer to the launch date.

items.title: Animoca Brands posted $314m bookings for FY2024
items.summary:
- Animoca Brands reported total bookings of US$314 million for FY2024, a rise from US$280 million in the previous year.
- The Digital Asset Advisory segment alone contributed US$165 million, marking a 116% year-on-year increase.
- In Q4 2024, bookings reached US$108 million, up from US$40 million in Q4 2023.
- Operating expenses decreased to US$217 million for FY2024 from US$246 million in FY2023.
- As of December 31, 2024, the company’s financial assets included US$293 million in cash and stablecoins, and digital assets valued at US$538 million.

items.title: J&T Express achieved first-ever annual profit in 2024
items.summary:
- J&T Express announced its first annual profit for 2024, with revenue up 15.9% to US$10.26 billion.
- Reported a net profit of US$110 million, recovering from a net loss of US$1.16 billion in 2023.
- Delivered 24.65 billion parcels, marking a 31% year-over-year growth in parcel volume.
- In Southeast Asia, market share grew to 28.6% with a 40.8% increase in parcel volume to 4.56 billion.
- Revenue from the Southeast Asian market reached US$3.22 billion, a rise of 22.3%.
- In China, parcel volume grew by 29.1% to 19.8 billion; revenue reached US$6.39 billion.
- Expansion into Saudi Arabia and UAE contributed to growth, with parcel volume growing 22.1% to 280 million.
- By the end of 2024, J&T Express operated 238 sorting centers and over 11,900 line-haul vehicles globally.

items.title: Smartisan founder’s next venture bets on AI
items.summary:
- Luo Yonghao, founder of Smartisan Technology, shifts focus to AI operating systems after prior ventures in livestream e-commerce and AR.
- He has recruited Wang Wenjun, a veteran in operating systems, to advance AI OS development through his AR-focused company, The Thin Red Line.
- The AI OS may be integrated with AI-driven hardware like smartphones, leveraging Wang’s expertise from Xiaomi and Oppo.
- The startup previously secured $50 million in angel investments from notable backers including Meituan Long-Z Investments and DJI.

items.title: Geely chairman Li Shufu urges innovation over price wars
items.summary:
- Geely chairman Li Shufu emphasizes the importance of innovation over engaging in price wars in the automotive industry.
- He advocates for breakthroughs in technology and product quality as key to staying competitive.
- Li Shufu's statements come amid a challenging market environment, where car manufacturers are pressured to lower prices.

items.title: Chinese courier giant SF Express orders 100 unmanned cargo planes
items.summary:
- SF Express, China’s largest express-delivery company, has ordered 100 ES1000 unmanned cargo planes from Yifei Aviation Technology.
- The ES1000, which debuted at the Zhuhai Airshow last November, allows operations from small airports and unpaved airstrips, enhancing delivery efficiency in remote areas.
- The agreement includes plans for pilot testing of ultra-short takeoff and landing (USTOL) aircraft for regional and last-mile delivery services.

items.title: No room for Thai fintech unicorns?
items.summary:
- Thailand's fintech market shows potential due to its GDP and banking sector but is hindered by established banks that limit innovation.
- A lack of venture capital and private equity funds stunts startup growth; corporate venture capital dominates the landscape.
- The largest banks have heavily invested in digitalization, reducing opportunities for fintech startups to offer consumer value.
- Foreign VC options exist but are challenged by a small market size and tough competition from local corporate investors.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in India
A16z leads funding round, valuing surveillance firm at $7.5b
items.summary:
- A16z has led a funding round for a surveillance firm valued at $7.5 billion.
- This investment signifies growing interest in surveillance technology amid increasing demand for security solutions.
- The valuation highlights a broader trend of capital being funneled into tech companies focused on surveillance capabilities.

items.title: Meta expands facial recognition in UK for scam prevention
items.summary:
- Meta launched facial recognition tools in the UK on March 5 to combat impersonation scams and assist account recovery.
- UK public figures will receive notifications to opt into 'celeb bait' protection, while all users can use 'video selfie verification'.
- Facial recognition data will only be used for security and deleted immediately after use.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet acquires $43.9m in bitcoin
items.summary:
- Metaplanet acquired an additional 497 bitcoin valued at US$43.9 million on Mar. 5.
- The bitcoin was purchased at an average price of US$88,448 per bitcoin.
- Total bitcoin holdings for Metaplanet increased to 2,888 BTC, acquired for about US$240.2 million at an average price of US$83,172 per bitcoin.
- Current market valuation of holdings is approximately US$251 million.

items.title: Regulator approves Samsung’s acquisition of robotics firm
items.summary:
- The Fair Trade Commission (FTC) of South Korea approved Samsung Electronics’ acquisition of robotics startup Rainbow Robotics on Mar. 5.
- The review process lasted two months and found little risk of monopoly from the deal.
- Samsung acquired a 35% stake in Rainbow Robotics for 86.8 billion won (US$59 million) in 2023.
- This acquisition is part of Samsung’s strategy to expand into robotics technologies, focusing on humanoid robots.
- Rainbow Robotics, founded in 2011, developed South Korea’s first two-legged walking robot, Hubo.
- Samsung plans to enhance humanoid robot development by combining Rainbow Robotics’ expertise with its own AI and software capabilities.

items.title: South Korea launches $34b fund for chips, automobiles
items.summary:
- South Korea has launched a $34 billion policy fund to support strategic industries, particularly semiconductors and automobiles.
- The fund, managed by the Korea Development Bank, aims to provide low-interest loans and investments over the next five years.
- It will target 12 'national strategic technologies' such as future mobility, aerospace, rechargeable batteries, and AI.
- Financial aid for the semiconductor industry from a previous program will be merged into this new initiative.
- To attract global talent, the government plans to offer top-tier visas and permanent residency to skilled professionals.

items.title: 50 rising startups and tech companies in India
Trump calls for repeal of Chips Act to cut national debt
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump urged lawmakers on Mar. 4 to repeal the Chips and Science Act, enacted in 2022.
- He suggested using unspent funds from the act to help reduce the national debt.
- The Chips Act allocated US$52.7 billion to enhance US semiconductor manufacturing and decrease reliance on foreign chips.
- It included US$39 billion in manufacturing subsidies and US$75 billion in government loans.
- The aim was to mitigate security risks tied to imported chips by promoting domestic manufacturing.
- Critics, including Trump, question the law’s effectiveness, despite the commerce department awarding over US$33 billion to chipmakers.

items.title: Google meets US regulators to address antitrust breakup plan
items.summary:
- Google representatives met with US regulators regarding antitrust measures that could lead to the company's breakup.
- The Department of Justice (DOJ) is examining Google's dominance in search and advertising, considering divestment of business units like Chrome.
- A Google spokesperson highlighted concerns about potential negative impacts on the US economy and national security.
- The trial for possible remedies in the search case is set to begin in April, with a ruling expected by August.

items.title: Shopee, loan growth fuel Sea Group’s 2nd profitable year
items.summary:
- Sea Group reported a 29% year-on-year revenue growth in 2024, its fastest since 2021.
- Key milestones were achieved by ecommerce platform Shopee and financial services unit SeaMoney, leading to a second consecutive full-year profit for Sea Group.
- Sea’s shares rose by 7% following the earnings report, and have increased by over 137% in the past year.
- The company expects double-digit growth across all units in 2025, with Shopee's gross merchandise value projected to grow by 20%.
- Shopee's revenue increased by 38% in 2024, contributing to its GMV surpassing US$100 billion.

items.title: Tesla’s China shipments drop as BYD surges in February
items.summary:
- Tesla's February wholesale shipments in China fell 49% year-on-year to 30,688 units.
- This is a decrease from January's shipments of 63,238 vehicles.
- BYD Co. sold over 318,000 electric and hybrid vehicles in February, a 161% increase year-on-year.
- BYD is maintaining a strong position in China's electric vehicle market.

items.title: US court denies Musk’s request over OpenAI’s for-profit shift
items.summary:
- A U.S. federal court denied Elon Musk's request to block OpenAI's shift to a for-profit model on Mar. 4.
- The ruling was made by Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers, stating Musk failed to meet the legal standard for an injunction.
- Musk claims the shift violates OpenAI's founding mission as a nonprofit focused on AI development for public benefit and expanded his lawsuit since December to include antitrust claims.
- OpenAI defended its transition to a for-profit model as necessary for funding AI development and welcomed the court's decision.

items.title: The female founders and leaders behind SEA’s top-funded startups
items.summary:
- The article focuses on female leaders in Southeast Asia's top 50 funded startups, highlighting their contributions to the tech industry.
- This initiative is part of Tech in Asia’s 2025 International Women’s Day campaign.
- The list features 66 women, indicating growth in equity and diversity in the region.
- Research was conducted using Tech in Asia’s database, LinkedIn, and company websites.
- Businesses with women in leadership roles tend to be more profitable and innovative, essential for the digital economy.

items.title: ByteDance to buyback US employees’ shares at $312b valuation
items.summary:
- ByteDance plans to buy back shares from its US employees.
- The valuation for the buyback is set at $312 billion.
- This move reflects the company's strategy to manage employee ownership post-IPO.

items.title: X upgrades Communities with new filters, sorting options
items.summary:
- X has upgraded its Communities feature to improve user interaction on specific topics.
- New filtering and sorting options include Trending, New, or Popular, with timeframes like day, week, month, year, or all-time.
- Users can now view their posts and replies within Communities, previously unavailable.
- Updates are currently available on iOS, with plans to expand to web and Android platforms.
- Community posts are now more visible to followers and allow public replies.
- Changes may be linked to X’s AI initiatives for Elon Musk’s AI venture, xAI.

items.title: Foxconn to invest $900m in AI server plant in Mexico
items.summary:
- Foxconn plans to invest approximately US$900 million in a new AI server manufacturing plant in Jalisco, Mexico.
- The project aims to become the largest assembly plant for servers using Nvidia’s GB200 AI chips.
- The development will occur in two phases: expanding an existing facility and constructing a new plant, projected to open by late 2025 or early 2026.

items.title: BMW sues BYD over ‘M6’ trademark dispute in Indonesia
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- BMW Group Indonesia has filed a lawsuit against BYD for the unauthorized use of the “M6” trademark in Indonesia.
- The lawsuit was lodged at the Central Jakarta Commercial Court on February 26.
- BMW claims that the “M6” name, which is registered in Indonesia, is well-known for high performance and exclusivity, and uses of the name by BYD could confuse consumers regarding product authenticity and quality.
- Jodie O’tania, BMW's communications director, confirmed the trademark's registration as of March 4.

items.title: Trump’s strategic crypto reserve proposal faces criticism
items.summary:
- Trump's proposal includes creating a strategic crypto reserve to support the U.S. economy.
- The proposal has received criticism from economists regarding its feasibility and potential risks.
- Critics argue that the plan may disrupt existing financial systems and create regulatory challenges.

items.title: Indian VC firm launches $100m fund for early-stage startups
S Korea telco firm, Microsoft partner to launch AI center
items.summary:
- South Korean telecommunications company KT Corp. partners with Microsoft to launch the AI Transformation Delivery Center (AX Delivery Center) this month.
- Initiative announced by CEO Kim Young-shub at Mobile World Congress (MWC) 2025, focusing on AI solutions for corporate needs.
- The project follows a five-year agreement worth 2.4 trillion won (US$1.6 billion) signed in October for AI and cloud development.
- KT to establish an AX strategic fund investing 13 billion won (US$8.93 million) with Microsoft providing GPU resources to support AI in startups and SMBs.
- KT plans to integrate its Mi:dm large language model with Microsoft’s AI solutions and collaborate on market-specific AI technologies.

items.title: Malaysia to pay $250m for access to Arm chip designs
items.summary:
- Malaysia will pay $250 million over ten years to Arm Holdings for access to seven chip design blueprints.
- Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli stated this initiative aims to improve the country’s semiconductor sector.
- The deal supports Malaysia’s strategy to leverage rising global AI and data center demand in the next 5 to 10 years.
- The government aims to support local chip manufacturers, planning to establish 10 domestic firms with revenues between $1.5 billion and $2 billion each.

items.title: GlobalFoundries CEO backs US tariffs to boost chip demand
items.author: Thomas Caulfield
items.summary:
- GlobalFoundries CEO Thomas Caulfield supports US tariffs on foreign-made chips to enhance demand for domestic semiconductors.
- At a Morgan Stanley investor conference on Mar. 4, he emphasized that tariffs, alongside the US$52.7 billion Chips and Science Act, could improve US chip manufacturing capabilities.
- Caulfield believes that tariffs will direct customers towards US-made chips, positively impacting semiconductor growth supported by government actions.

items.title: Amazon launches agentic AI division under AWS leadership
items.summary:
- Amazon has created a new division for agentic AI to automate tasks without manual prompts.
- The division will be led by Swami Sivasubramanian, reporting directly to AWS CEO Matt Garman.
- Agentic AI capabilities will be released to select customers later this month.
- AWS is restructuring by moving AI groups like Bedrock and SageMaker under compute and forming a new customer experience team.
- Following the announcements, Amazon’s stock dipped slightly, closing down less than 1% at US$204.81.

items.title: Apple appeals UK order to access encrypted iCloud data
items.summary:
- Apple has filed an appeal with the UK Investigatory Powers Tribunal against an order demanding access to encrypted iCloud files.
- The order, issued in January 2023 under the Investigatory Powers Act of 2016, challenges Apple's end-to-end encryption feature.
- Following the order, Apple suspended its advanced data protection feature in the UK and aims to restore it through the appeal.

items.title: Zepto CEO refutes Zomato’s quick commerce cash burn claim
items.summary:
- Zepto's CEO addressed claims made by Zomato regarding cash burn in quick commerce.
- The statements challenge the narrative about the profitability and spending strategies in the quick commerce sector.
- This dialogue highlights ongoing competition and scrutiny within the food delivery market in India.

items.title: Taiwan to review TSMC investment in US, gov’t says
items.summary:
- Taiwanese government to evaluate TSMC's proposed US investments for strategic alignment in semiconductor industry.
- TSMC plans to invest $100 billion, including five new chip manufacturing facilities.
- Announcement made by TSMC CEO and former President Trump on Mar. 3, 2025.
